Detailed Description

Functions for reading and writing archive entries.

Function Documentation

int fa_close ( fa_file_t *  file,
fa_dirinfo_t *  info 
)

Close a file and finalize changes.

Parameters:
fileFile to close
infoIf specified, this instance will receive information about the file (including final compressed size and content hash)
Returns:
0 if operation was successful, <0 otherwise
int fa_lseek ( fa_file_t *  file,
int64_t  offset,
fa_seek_t  whence 
)

Seek to a new location in file.

Parameters:
fileFile to seek in
offsetOffset to use when seeking
whenceWhat mode to use when seeking
Returns:
0 if seeking was successful, <0 otherwise
Note:
Seeking when writing is not supported
fa_file_t* fa_open ( fa_archive_t *  archive,
const char *  filename,
fa_compression_t  compression,
fa_dirinfo_t *  info 
)

Open a file in an archive for reading or writing.

File mode is decided by how the archive was initially opened.

Parameters:
archiveArchive to access
filenameFile to access
compressionWhat compression to use (when reading, pass FA_COMPRESSION_NONE)
infoIf specified when opening for reading, this instance will receive information about the file
Returns:
File ready to access, or NULL on error
Note:
When writing, opening a file with the same name more than once will NOT replace the old one; a new instance will be created (but will be inaccessible by name)
When opening a file for reading, passing @ followed by a 40-character hexadecimal string will allow opening a file for access through its content hash
fa_file_t* fa_open_hash ( fa_archive_t *  archive,
const fa_hash_t *  hash 
)

Open an entry in the archive based on its content hash.

This is an optimized path if you already have the content hash in a binary format

Parameters:
archiveArchive to access
hashHash to use as key
Returns:
File ready to read from
Note:
This only supports read-access for obvious reasons
size_t fa_read ( fa_file_t *  file,
void *  buffer,
size_t  length 
)

Read data from file.

Parameters:
fileFile to read data from
bufferBuffer that receives read data
lengthNumber of bytes to attempt to read
Returns:
Number of bytes actually read from file
Note:
This method will transparently decompress data
size_t fa_tell ( fa_file_t *  file )

Return current location in file.

Parameters:
fileFile to query for current file pointer
Returns:
Offset in file
size_t fa_write ( fa_file_t *  file,
const void *  buffer,
size_t  length 
)

Write data to file.

Parameters:
fileFile to write data into
bufferBuffer that contains data to write
lengthNumber of bytes
Returns:
Number of bytes written; in case of an error this will NOT match the incoming length parameter
